spender_paths.core_principle: Spender level determines how much inefficiency you can afford. F2P must be near-perfect, whales can be strategically wasteful.

f2p.label: Free-to-Play
f2p.resource_reality: Very limited Chief Gear XP, Mythic materials, Hero shards. Cannot recover from mistakes quickly.

chief_gear.strategy: Focus on 2-3 pieces ahead of rest. Do NOT rush Mythic on everything.

rules: Only field PvP or solo use

low_spender.label: Low Spender (Battle Pass / small packs)
low_spender.resource_reality: Steady but slow income. Can correct small mistakes. Still punished by major misallocations.

chief_gear.strategy: Ring + Amulet pushed ahead. Can begin equalizing Gloves/Boots sooner.

rules: Must be used across multiple modes

medium_spender.label: Medium Spender
medium_spender.resource_reality: Can sustain upgrades. Can recover from mistakes. Still benefits from efficiency.

chief_gear.strategy: Ring & Amulet to Mythic early. Remaining pieces can follow closer behind.

whale.label: Whale
whale.resource_reality: Resource constraints effectively removed. Speed > efficiency. Short-term dominance is goal.

chief_gear.strategy: Max everything fast. No opportunity cost concern.

can_do: Gear heroes knowing they'll be replaced

chief_gear.mode_coverage: 100% - rallies, field PvP, garrison, Bear Trap, Crazy Joe, SvS

investment_hierarchy: 4. Hero Gear on long-term core heroes
hero_gear_conditions: Hero is used as rally leader (not just joiner)
Chief Ring and Amulet at target tier first

chief_gear.description: Global combat buffs that apply to ALL heroes and troops. Always active once equipped.

upgrade_priority.applies_to: All heroes, all marches, all events

common_mistakes.mistake: Upgrading Infantry gear first because infantry tanks
common_mistakes.correction: Infantry stats matter LESS than damage multipliers in PvP/SvS
Epic/Legendary gear is temporary; Mythic is the real target
Lethality directly impacts kill count & battle outcome in SvS
Joiner hero gear barely matters - only 1 expedition skill contributes. Chief Gear still fully applies.

common_mistakes.mistake: Dumping hero gear into Gen 1 heroes too early
common_mistakes.correction: Generation risk - heroes get outclassed. Gear on retired hero = dead capital.

common_mistakes.mistake: Neglecting Ring/Amulet because heroes feel stronger
common_mistakes.correction: Chief Gear multiplies ALL damage; hero gear is narrow. Ring/Amulet first always.

common_mistakes.mistake: Treating hero gear and chief gear as equal systems
common_mistakes.correction: Chief Gear = universal multiplier (always high ROI). Hero Gear = conditional amplifier (context-dependent ROI).

sources: Whiteout Survival Wiki - Chief Gear Upgrading & Forging
